meanings.definition: Not forming a harmonic or pleasing combination
meanings.sent1: The inharmonic notes clashed together in an unpleasant way.
meanings.sent2: The inharmonic mix of colors hurt my eyes.
meanings.sent3: The inharmonic blend of spices made the soup taste strange.
meanings.sent4: Their inharmonic opinions created a cacophony of disagreement.
meanings.sent5: The inharmonic jumble of patterns on the shirt was hard to look at.

meanings.sent1: The inharmonic music made my ears ring.
meanings.sent2: The inharmonic notes clashed in an unpleasant way.
meanings.sent3: The inharmonic melody sounded like a cat walking on a piano.
meanings.sent4: The inharmonic symphony left the audience bewildered.
meanings.sent5: The inharmonic choir practice was a painful experience for all.

meanings.sent1: Their inharmonic relationship led to constant arguments.
meanings.sent2: The inharmonic team struggled to work together effectively.
meanings.sent3: The inharmonic decision-making process caused confusion.
meanings.sent4: The inharmonic family gathering ended in a heated debate.
meanings.sent5: The inharmonic group dynamic made collaboration difficult.
